Sentencas: Interconnects employed in solid oxide fuel cells require electrically conductive protective coatings such as those based on manganese cobalt oxide spinels in order to prevent evaporation of volatile Cr(VI)-compounds and to minimize high temperature corrosion.
Titulo: Post-mortem evaluation of oxidized atmospheric plasma sprayed Mn-Co-Fe oxide spinel coatings on SOFC interconnectors

Sentencas: MnCo2-xFexO4 based (where x = 0.1 and 0.3) oxide spinel protective coatings were manufactured by the atmospheric plasma spraying process on Crofer 22 APU substrates.
Titulo: Post-mortem evaluation of oxidized atmospheric plasma sprayed Mn-Co-Fe oxide spinel coatings on SOFC interconnectors

Sentencas: The coated substrates were oxidized at 700 degrees C in air for 1000 h and post-mortem analyses were conducted to study the performance of the thermal sprayed coatings.
Titulo: Post-mortem evaluation of oxidized atmospheric plasma sprayed Mn-Co-Fe oxide spinel coatings on SOFC interconnectors

Sentencas: During the high temperature oxidation, a four-point on-line measurement technique was used for area specific resistance studies.
Titulo: Post-mortem evaluation of oxidized atmospheric plasma sprayed Mn-Co-Fe oxide spinel coatings on SOFC interconnectors

Sentencas: The MnCo1.7Fe0.3O4 coating was tested together with the La0.85Sr0.15Mn1.1O3-spacer.
Titulo: Post-mortem evaluation of oxidized atmospheric plasma sprayed Mn-Co-Fe oxide spinel coatings on SOFC interconnectors

Sentencas: The atmospheric plasma sprayed MnCo2-xFexO4 showed excellent Cr-barrier properties and decreased oxidation of the substrate.
Titulo: Post-mortem evaluation of oxidized atmospheric plasma sprayed Mn-Co-Fe oxide spinel coatings on SOFC interconnectors

Sentencas: In addition, resistance as low as 9.20 m Omega cm(2) values was obtained after the 1000 h oxidation cycle.
Titulo: Post-mortem evaluation of oxidized atmospheric plasma sprayed Mn-Co-Fe oxide spinel coatings on SOFC interconnectors

Sentencas: The MnCo1.9Fe0.1O4, coating manufactured by the atmospheric plasma spraying process is a promising candidate for SOFC interconnect applications.
Titulo: Post-mortem evaluation of oxidized atmospheric plasma sprayed Mn-Co-Fe oxide spinel coatings on SOFC interconnectors
